comment._content: Wow, great pic. This tree will be cut down shortly. it still stands.

very cool, it had a really good life

comment.author: 29853290@N00
comment._content: What a cool photo...she almost looks like a little doll standing in front of that tree! I too had my photo taken here many times as a child. Maybe there should be a pool for photos of this tree?!?

comment.author: 87914514@N00
comment._content:
I also had my picture taken there- the first time I visited Vancouver, aged 10.
When we moved there a year later, we used to visit this tree often.

I can't believe it's being cut down now.

comment.author: 31007673@N07
comment._content: Wow! When I was a kid Hollow Tree was almost as tall...well maybe half the size---late 50's. Now there's almost nothing left. The Woseley tree was roughly the same size, maybe larger, but Winnipeg cut it down.

comment.author: 73806683@N00
comment._content: So sad that it's being cut down :(

comment.author: 14306867@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Waking Into the Dream, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 7186636@N06
comment._content: Une excellente photo du temps passé !

comment.author: 34427466731@N01
comment._content: This image has been used in the indicommons.org post "Great Cedar Tree", along with a link to the cbc.ca story "70 trees get axe from park board, but Hollow Tree wins reprieve"

comment.author: 34427466731@N01
comment._content: yes. this tree has a lot of history. it'll probably receive a little bit more with the upcoming olympics too - if it hasn't been removed by then.

comment.author: 32124404@N05
comment._content:
Alice in Wonderland… Where is the rabbit ?

comment.author: 22323738@N00
comment._content:
I played in this tree so many times as a girl. It is sad to think that Mother Nature has decided that it has had it's day in the sun. 

When I lived in Vancouver and had to go to the north shore I would always make time to go through the park on my way to the bridge in part because I always enjoyed seeing this landmark as I rounded the sharp corner where it has stood for so many years. 

Truley it is sad that it can't be saved.

comment.author: 87914514@N00
comment._content: Actually, there is good news for Vancouver's famous hollow tree: It's being Saved! If you have fond memories of this tree and want to help you can even donate money to help with the rescue effort: www.savethehollowtree.com/

comment.author: 78598560@N00
comment._content:
This looks like the remains of the tree in the above photo. The tree is truncated at about 15 feet and is now rootless.  It now sits at the side of the road in Stanley Park (near Third Beach.) Check out other big trees on TREKNATURE - just punch in "noonataq"
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/78598560@N00/4643807430/in/set-72157623959701337/]
